10.27.16  3:12 pm   What the fuck did you just fucking say about me, you little bitch? IÕll have you know I graduated top of my class in the Navy Seals, and IÕve been involved in numerous secret raids on Al-Quaeda, and I have over 300 confirmed kills. I am trained in gorilla warfare and IÕm the top sniper in the entire US armed forces. You are nothing to me but just another target. I will wipe you the fuck out with precision the likes of which has never been seen before on this Earth, mark my fucking words. You think you can get away with saying that shit to me over the Internet? Think again, fucker. As we speak I am contacting my secret network of spies across the USA and your IP is being traced right now so you better prepare for the storm, maggot. The storm that wipes out the pathetic little thing you call your life. YouÕre fucking dead, kid. I can be anywhere, anytime, and I can kill you in over seven hundred ways, and thatÕs just with my bare hands. Not onl y am I extensively trained in unarmed combat, but I have access to the entire arsenal of the United States Marine Corps and I will use it to its full extent to wipe your miserable ass off the face of the continent, you little shit. If only you could have known what unholy retribution your little ÒcleverÓ comment was about to bring down upon you, maybe you would have held your fucking tongue. But you couldnÕt, you didnÕt, and now youÕre paying the price, you goddamn idiot. I will shit fury all over you and you will drown in it. YouÕre fucking dead, kiddo.

10.27.16  2:06 pm   You might be asked like thirty times before you write a response but in case you haven't, Vine had just announced that they are discontinuing their service in the coming months. They'll keep old videos online. I remember back before History of Japan you were kinda in a love-hate relationship with Vine because it allowed you to trim and really concentrate your content, but doing so was kinda addicting(?) in a way and it sorta stagnated you from making longer videos until you made the bold move to cut Vine off entirely during HoJ production. I'm sorry if this question seems to be spiraling out of control or maybe I'm just rambling, but I'm curious to understand why Vine was an appealing outlet for your content at the time and if you've "grown out" of it and don't mind the discontinuation too much or if you still have some fondness for that service. Thanks for reading, regardless!
